p.s: Rhetorical devices are often used to lay focus on certain aspects fo a speech.
In the following it will be analysed how Obama uses them and what their intended effect is.
By using the climax geography and ideology; race and religion; wealth and opportunity (l. 5-6) Obama mentions all the things that could seperateseparate the people but do not.
He goes on to say how he impressed he was by all the values and hopes they share (l. 8-9).
He talks about this to show the people that it does not matter where you live or how wealthy you are; everybody shares the same values.
The contrast big cities and small towns; among men and women; young and old; black, white and brown (l. 9-10) emphasizes again that it is irrelevant who you are, every American wants the same thing.
He does this to make the audience feel included in his dreams for the country.
The anecdote about his grandfather (l. 13-16) is supposed to give an example of what the American Dream is.
This is supposed to make Americans proud of their dream and show them how good of a dream it actually is.
Another anecdote he gives is about his mother (l. 17-20).
He mentions this story to show that every American should believe in the American Dream.
By mentioning both of these anecdotes Obama creates a bond to show them that he believed in the American Dream and that it payed out.
He wants to show that the American Dream is reality.
The repetition of the words no matter what (l. 19-20) underlines the fact that it is irrelevant who you are.
Everybody can make it.
Obama encourages his audience to believe in the American Dream by doing this.
The metaphor the American Dream was slipping away (l. 25) is supposed to strengthen the fact that the American Dream was fading away.
He does this to show the audience that he deeply cares about the people and that he genuinlygenuinely wants the best for America.
Summing up one can say that Barack Obama used rhetorical devices to convince the American'sAmericans to believe in the American Dream.
He also wanted to showsshow that he cares deeply about the American people.
